meanings.definition: One side of something many-sided, especially of a cut gem.
meanings.sent1: The diamond sparkled as light bounced off its many facets.
meanings.sent2: She admired the different facets of his personality, each one unique and intriguing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the gem's facets to play a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence shone through the many facets of her work, each one reflecting a different skill.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of the city through the facets of a crystal, each angle revealing a new detail.

meanings.definition: A particular aspect or feature of something.
meanings.sent1: The historical documentary explored various facets of the war, shedding light on different perspectives.
meanings.sent2: His speech touched on the important facets of the economy, highlighting key areas for improvement.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the mundane facets of daily life, turning them into hilarious scenarios.
meanings.sent4: Love can be seen in the smallest facets of a relationship, like sharing a smile or a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The book delved into the darker facets of human nature, exploring the complexities of good and evil.
